result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter E. Rubel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $150.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs are to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:46 AM: Defendant Peter E. Rubel in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Variety of letters have been rec'd from Oswald Counseling - Assessments have been completed.  Leaves at the discretion of the Court if that will satisfy compliance.  Notes no further criminal conduct has occurred during the pendency.  Def advised of right to counsel.   Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.  Chapter 950 in compliance - victim present in courtroom.  Statement offered by victim prior to sentencing.  Statement offered by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Finds there has been substantial compliance with the offer extended previously - compliance directs the imposition of court costs as sentence.  60 DTP or PP.  Costs to include Surcharge - tho due to pre-April offense - no sample to be provided.  Bond to be applied.  Appeal Rights Given.
from Oswald Counseling Associates Inc, Dated 3/21/2016 Re:  Discharge Summary
from Oswald Counseling Associates, Inc - AODA Initial Assessment

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:10 PM: Defendant Peter E. Rubel in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not want counsel today and is prepared to resolve matter with NC plea.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Per DA - victim present in the courtroom today and will make a statement prior to any sentencing today.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement to the Court by victim.  Argument by DA as to penalty - argues for probation sentence.  Statement by Def:  Yes, requests lesser probation term due to employment concerns.  Supervisor is present in the courtroom and confirms employment restrictions.  Firearm restrictions discussed.  Def understands possible consequences.  Court questions the victim directly.  Further statement by Victim.  The Court:  Authorizes release on a $5000 Signature Bond.  Conditions of bond: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Deferred SEH agreement imposed by the Court.  SEH one year from now.  At time of sentencing:  Completed AODA with documentation provided to the Court - and follow thru with any recommended counseling or treatment of that assessment; Complete an Anger Mgmt Program coordinated thru DOC or the resources at the Def's disposal - in all likelihood a part of his insurance benefits.  No DAAP ordered; Court demands that there is no violations of bond, none at all, during the pendency of the bond; No firearm restrictions ordered - however suggests that any firearms be removed from the household, not a bond condition simply a suggestion. Should items described are accomplished within the coming year, Court will order Court Costs only as penalty at the sentencing hearing. Due to the cash posted - bond ordered at $150 Cash Bond.
